comments.author: dbshck
comments.body: As cryptoaddictchie mentioned, there's no mining in Polygon as it's a PoS coin.With regards to its supply schedule, according to Messari (https://messari.io/asset/polygon/profile/supply-schedule), the only tranche left to be distributed/vested is the staking rewards. This distribution is planned to be completed by April 2025. By then, the total supply of MATIC should be at 10 billions.

comments.author: dbshck
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on February 12, 2023, 11:45:02 AMHello,Thank you for the useful link. Is Bitcoin finishing by February 2028?No. In Bitcoin, new coins are issued and rewarded to miners who successfully mined a block. The reward for each block is currently at 6.25 bitcoins. This reward halves every 210,000 blocks (approximately every 4 years). It's hard to estimate when the supply cap will be reached, but it's definitely not going to happen in Feb 2028. By 2028, we're likely still seeing block rewards at 3.125 or 1.5625 per block. Here's a page if you want to see the historical supply, previous halving date, and the short term forecast https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Controlled_supply
